videoSnippet.title: The Nameless Immortal | Sasikiran vs Artemiev || (2019)
videoSnippet.description:
Watch interview with Sasikiran here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5KhemwBzNfo

Download agadmator chess clock here https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.agadmator.chessclock&fbclid=IwAR3b_sRch6nsuW59-bWoirVDMMJ8V5jexZdUB0bsxQrc0Q8imvkBtqkHUXQ&rdid=com.agadmator.chessclock

Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Krishnan Sasikiran vs Vladislav Artemiev
Karpov Poikovsky (2019), rd 3, Jun-08 
Sicilian Defense: Najdorf (B90) 

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 e6 7. Be3 b5 8. Qd2 b4 9. Na4 Nbd7 10. O-O-O Qa5 11. b3 Bb7 12. a3 Qc7 13. axb4 d5 14. Bf2 Bd6 15. Bg3 Bxg3 16. hxg3 dxe4 17. g4 Nd5 18. Bc4 Ne5 19. Bxd5 exd5 20. fxe4 dxe4 21. Nf5 O-O 22. Qc3 Rfc8 23. Nc5 f6 24. Qh3 h6 25. g5 fxg5 26. Rd7 Nxd7 27. Nxh6+ gxh6 28. Qe6+ Kg7 29. Qxh6+ Kf7 30. Qe6+ Kg7 31. Qe7+ Kg6 32. Qh7+ Kf6 33. Nxd7+ Ke6 34. Qg6+ Kd5 35. Rd1#

The 20th Karpov International Chess Tournament is taking place in the small Siberian town of Poikovsky, Russia from 6-15 June, 2019. The event is a 10-player single round-robin.

The time control is 100 minutes for 40 moves, followed by 50 minutes for 20 moves, then 15 minutes until the end of the game, with a 30-second increment from move 1.
To those of you who read the description: You are an excellent subscriber! :)

Check out agadmator's merch here https://teespring.com/stores/agadmators-swag-store
https://teespring.com/design-with-a-story-tm

judgment.name: Inaccuracy
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Kf8 was best.

judgment.name: Inaccuracy
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Qxd7 was best.
